text: Can I have you state your full name for the record.

text: Have you ever given a deposition before?

text: I'm going to go through and give you some instructions on how this process is going to work, okay?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: We're here for a question-and-answer session.  I'm going to be asking you questions.  You're going to be responding to them.  There is a court reporter seated to your left.  She's taking down all those questions, your answers, and anything your attorney might want to add to this proceeding, okay?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: I'm going to ask that you verbalize your responses and you keep your voice up so that everybody in the room can hear you, okay?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: If I ask you a question that you don't understand, please don't answer it.  Just let me know; say I don't understand what you're asking me.  I'll try to rephrase it so that you do understand it and can provide me an answer, okay?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: I'm not here to trick you today.  I'm trying to gather information about this accident.  If you don't know the answer to my question, it's okay to tell me I don't know as long as that's the truthful response. It's also okay to tell me you don't recall because this may have happened some time ago and you don't remember what happened or you don't remember the answer to a particular question I have. If I ask you for something like speed, distance, or time and you don't exactly know but you can provide us with a reasonable estimation or approximation, I ask that you do that, but let us know.  Let us know that you are approximating or estimating.  I'm sure your lawyer doesn't want you guessing at things today.  I don't want you guessing at things today.  I want as accurate information as you can, all right?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: If you need to take a break here at any point, please just ask me, and I will accommodate you.  I just ask, if I have a question pending, you answer it and then we'll take a break, okay?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: I don't expect to be here too long with you today, but there are some areas I have to cover. Do you understand those instructions?
speaker: MR. ARNER

text: Also, just for her sake, if I ask you a question and I haven't finished my question, allow me to get the whole question out and I'll give you time to answer.  That way you and I aren't speaking over one another, okay?
